tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Earned conditional PGA TOUR China Series' status when he T16 at the Second Global Qualifying Tournament in early February. A disappointing, third-round 81 kept him from gaining full playing privileges. Other rounds were 74-71-70.

2014: Played on the All American Gateway Tour, enjoying a top finish of T5 at the event in mid-December at Troon North's Monument Course in Arizona. Shot rounds of 69-71-71 to finish tied with PGAQ TOUR veterans Todd Demsey and Michael Letzig and two others, five shots behind winner John Catlin…Other top-20s came at the Fall Tournament No. 2 (T17) and Fall Tournament No. 3 (T19)…Attended the first stage of the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament but did not advance.

2013: Again played on the All American Gateway Tour, picking up one lone top-10—a T10 at the Wigwam Gold at the Wigwam Resort's Gold Course in mid-March…Attended both the PGA TOUR Canada and Latinoamérica Qualifying Tournaments but did not earn his card. 

2012: Played in seven PGA TOUR Canada events, a T50 at the Canadian Tour Championship in late-August his top outing among his four made cuts…Played a full slate of All American Gateway Tour tournaments between January and April, making six cuts. Top performance was a T11 at Tournament 11 at Trilogy GC…Other top-20s came at Tournament 7 (T14) and Tournament 8 (T17).

2008: Struggled playing the All American Gateway Tour, making only one cut, at Desert Winter Tournament 1 in January, where he recorded a T47 showing.

2007: Had a solid All American Gateway Tour campaign after missing the first four cuts to begin the Desert Summer season. Made six of eight cuts to finish the season—his top effort a T12 in Tournament 9 at Longbow GC. Shot three rounds in the 60s to T12 (69-67-69)…Added a T17 at Tournament 7 at Wigwam Resort's Gold Course.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was the 2001 Junior Golf Association of Arizona Player of the Year as a 17-year-old…In 2005, won the Arizona Amateur…Played collegiate golf at Drake University in Des Moines, Iowa. Finished T9 at the Missouri Valley Championship his senior year, with his team finishing second in the team competition, two strokes behind champion Wichita State.
tourBios.personal: Was an accomplished baseball player who gave up the sport as a teenager to concentrate on golf.

dyn.dynStats: He ranks T11th in Victory Leaders on the PGA Tour China Series.
